SESWrapper Library Variables

SESWrapper variables are referenced by name, i.e. strings of type char*. There are two main types of variables; Properties or Data Parameters. Properties are settings often found in configuration files, whereas Data Parameters are items created when an operation has been completed, such as the result from calls to WRP_InitAcquisition() and WRP_StartAcquisition(). The properties present in the SESWrapper library are listed in Properties followed by a list of the available data parameters.

Variable Types

Data and settings are handled through properties controlled by the WVariable class. Internally, each property is mapped to an index (enumeration WSESWrapperMain::Property), but applications that accesses the data use strings to specify the names of the properties. The value of a property is obtained from a call to WSESWrapperMain::getProperty() and modified by a call to WSESWrapperMain::setProperty(). For acquired data, the mechanizm is similar, but the results are obtained from calls to WSESWrapperMain::getAcquiredData(). These functions use a void* argument for the value of the properties. To increase the stability of the library code, the property types are also stored together with the names and indices. The property types available in the SESWrapper library can be found in the documentation of WVariable.

The WSESWrapperMain::getProperty() and WSESWrapperMain::getAcquiredData() member functions make use of a size parameter. The importance of this parameter is especially noticable for the string and vector property types. When the value parameter is set to 0 and the property is of type String or Vector, the size parameter is modified to indicate the required length of the value array. If the value parameter is non-zero, the size parameter must specify the size of the buffer to which the data will be copied.

Properties

The following table describes the properties available by calling WSESWrapperMain::getProperty() or WSESWrapperMain::setProperty(). The properties that are read-only are marked with ro. Some of the properties require an Index to specify which value to receive when reading. The current version of SESWrapper only uses the index parameter when reading, and not when writing properties. This may change in the future.

NameTypeIndexDescription
lib_descriptionSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING N/ADescription of the library (ro)
lib_versionSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING N/AVersion code consisting of a series of numbers separated by dots: <major>.<minor>.<revision>[.<build>[.<branch>]] (ro)
lib_errorSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING Error codeGives the error message corresponding to the index error code
lib_working_dirSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING N/AThe working directory for the current application
instrument_librarySESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING N/AThe name of the SES instrument library being wrapped. This can optionally include a drive letter and file path.
instrument_statusSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AThe status of the instrument. The value can be one of the SesNS::InstrumentStatus values. (ro)
always_delay_regionSESWrapperNS::TYPE_BOOL N/AIf true, the region delay is applied even when HV supplies are not changed
allow_io_with_detectorSESWrapperNS::TYPE_BOOL N/AIf true, allows simultaneous acquisition of both External IO and detector
instrument_modelSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING N/AThe name of the currently installed instrument (ro)
instrument_serial_noSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING N/AThe serial number of the currently installed instrument (ro)
detector_infoSESWrapperNS::TYPE_DETECTORINFO N/ADetectorInfo struct (ro)
detector_regionSESWrapperNS::TYPE_DETECTORREGION N/ADetectorRegion struct (ro)
element_set_countSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AThe number of installed element sets (ro)
element_setSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING -1, or 0 -- (element_set_count - 1)Reads or changes the current element set if index = -1. For index >= 0, queries the name of element set index.
element_name_countSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AThe number of installed elements (ro)
element_nameSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING 0 -- (element_name_count - 1)For index >= 0, queries the name of element index. (ro)
lens_mode_countSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AThe number of available lens modes (ro)
lens_modeSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING -1, or 0 -- (lens_mode_count - 1)Reads or changes the current lens mode if index = -1. For index >= 0, queries the name of lens mode index.
pass_energy_countSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AThe number of available pass energies for the current lens mode (ro)
pass_energySESWrapperNS::TYPE_DOUBLE -1, or 0 -- (pass_energy_count - 1)Reads or changes the current pass energy if index = -1. For index >= 0, queries the value of pass energy index.
analyzer_regionSESWrapperNS::TYPE_ANALYZERREGION N/AAnalyzerRegion struct. Contains the region settings for the next acquisition. These settings may be modified by the library when calling WSESWrapperMain::checkRegion()
use_binding_energySESWrapperNS::TYPE_BOOL N/ASpecifies whether the energy ranges in the analyzer region will be given in binding energy. If false, kinetic energy is assumed. To use binding energy, you also need to call WRP_SetExcitationEnergy(). Default is false
use_external_ioSESWrapperNS::TYPE_BOOL N/ABoolean property that enables or disables the External IO interface. This is often used for spin detectors.
use_detectorSESWrapperNS::TYPE_BOOL N/ABoolean property that enables or disables the detector. Use this property in combination with use_external_io.
use_spinSESWrapperNS::TYPE_BOOL DetectorBoolean property that enables or disables a specific spin detector.
region_nameSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING N/AThis property defines the name of the current region. The name is limited to max 32 characters.
temp_file_nameSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING N/AThis property defines the name of the temporary file created when performing an acquisition.
reset_data_between_iterationsSESWrapperNS::TYPE_BOOL N/ABoolean property that allows for a reset of spectrum and external I/O data between each iteration. Operates faster than calling WSESWrapperMain::initAcquisition().

Data Parameters

The acquired data is accessed through a mechanizm similar to the properties described above. The data is stored as Data Parameters, and accessed through the WSESWrapperMain::getAcquiredData() member funciton. The table shown below lists the available data parameters. It is important to note that these variables should only be accessed after the start of an acquisition (calling the startAcquisition() member function). If a data parameter is read before the start of an acquisition, the result is undefined.

NameTypeIndexDescription
acq_channelsSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AThe number of channels in acquired data.
acq_slicesSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AThe number of slices in acquired data.
acq_iterationsSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AThe number of calls to startAcquisition() iterations that have passed since last call to initAcquisition()
acq_intensity_unitSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING N/AThe unit of the intensity scale (e.g. "counts/s")
acq_channel_unitSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING N/AThe unit of the channels scale (e.g. "eV")
acq_slice_unitSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING N/AThe unit of the slices scale (e.g. "mm")
acq_spectrumSESWrapperNS::TYPE_VECTOR_DOUBLE N/AThe integrated spectrum
acq_imageSESWrapperNS::TYPE_VECTOR_DOUBLE N/AThe 2D matrix of acquired data
acq_sliceSESWrapperNS::TYPE_VECTOR_DOUBLE Y channelAccess one slice from the acquired data. The index parameter specifies which slice to access
acq_channel_scaleSESWrapperNS::TYPE_VECTOR_DOUBLE N/AThe channels scale
acq_slice_scaleSESWrapperNS::TYPE_VECTOR_DOUBLE N/AThe slices scale
acq_current_pointSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AIndex to the current point during a swept mode acquisition.
acq_point_intensitySESWrapperNS::TYPE_DOUBLE Energy channelThe intensity of one specific energy channel.
acq_raw_imageSESWrapperNS::TYPE_VECTOR_INT32 N/AThe last image taken by the detector
acq_current_stepSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AThe current step in a swept mode acquisition
acq_elapsed_timeSESWrapperNS::TYPE_DOUBLE N/AThe elapsed time (ms) since last call of WRP_InitAcquisition() or WRP_StartAcquisition()
acq_io_portsSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AThe number of ports available from External IO interface measurements
acq_io_sizeSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AThe size of each vector from External IO data
acq_io_iterationsSESWrapperNS::TYPE_INT32 N/AThe number of times the External IO data has been acquired
acq_io_unitSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING N/AThe unit of the External IO data vectors
acq_io_scaleSESWrapperNS::TYPE_VECTOR_DOUBLE N/AThe scale of the External IO data
acq_io_spectrumSESWrapperNS::TYPE_VECTOR_DOUBLE Port indexData from one of the available ports in the External IO interface. The index parameter specifies which port to access. The size of the resulting vector is acq_io_size
acq_io_dataSESWrapperNS::TYPE_VECTOR_DOUBLE N/AA matrix of all data from the available ports in the External IO interface. The size of the resulting vector is acq_io_ports * acq_io_size
acq_io_port_nameSESWrapperNS::TYPE_STRING Port indexThe name of the IO port indicated by the index parameter
